Description: Papyrus. Demotic memorandum of 11 lines on recto. Verso: blank (faint traces of washed-off text). All the margins are preserved, but there are a series of holes in the papyrus that affect the reading.
Curator's comments: The memorandum is sent to or by a 'watch-commander'. Its contents are unclear but appear to refer to the delivery/sale of a number of items, including a bed, each of which is given a monetary value. It is dated to a year 10 of an unspecified pharaoh.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (380998) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/380998)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fragmentary, frayed, loss Black ink (smudged) Tabbed: kraft paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: kraft paper Object Priority: B Mount Priority: B Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair - lacunae
